channel.title: I can compile, but I can't get my server to run?
channel.description: Okay, so I got it to where I can compile my server, but when I go to run it is gives me the "Java is not recognized as in internal or external command?" WTF? I never had this problem before..

item.title: I can compile, but I can't get my server to run?
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

Genjoi:

Hmm, can you give me a better example?

oke see my run has this

@echo off title Project Insanity "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause
( the (x86) is cuz windows 7 )
u dont need that
but oke go to C:
then go to ur programfiles
then go to ur java
and then u see some few tings like a jdk or a jre or just a bin
so for example we say
in ur java map u got a jre6 click on it and find the bin
if ugot a bin map anywehre else just use that so i give a few examples

if u go into ur java map and there is just a bin file then is this ur run

@echo off title Project Insanity "C:\Program Files\Java\bin\java.exe" -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause

if you got a jre6 file in ur java map then is this ur run

@echo off title Project Insanity "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause

item.title: I can compile, but I can't get my server to run?
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

[quote=“pimple, post:3, topic:371201”][quote author=oldschool-scape link=topic=467284.msg3416804#msg3416804 date=1291159308]
aah man thats not cool maybe some1 messed with u java???

tell me what kind of pc u got ( windows 7 ) ( xp) ( vista)
an were u javac ( in a jdk ) file is like: program files\java\Jdk…\bin\javac.exe < ---- example tell me how it looks like urs

i will get u a working compiler
[/quote]

He can get his compiler to work, so he has the JDK.
It’s the server he has issues with.

OT: Are the ports connected?[/quote]

oww readedit wrong :S hmm idk what about making a PATH?
